text: Roger Baulu (28 February 1910 – 17 September 1997) was a Canadian radio and television host. He was a pioneer on the airwaves of Montreal radio station CKAC and on Ici Radio-Canada Télé radio and television. In 1990, he was inducted into the Canadian Association of Broadcasters Hall of Fame. After his death in 1997, he was entombed at the Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery in Montreal. == References == == External links == * * Category:1910 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Canadian radio hosts Category:Canadian television hosts Category:French Quebecers Category:People from Montreal Category:Notre Dame des Neiges Cemetery burials
title: Roger Baulu
